prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape Description Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism is slightly angled and has a smooth, shiny surface. Create Coordinate System Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.75, 0.0] Create 2D Sketch on Plane Create a new 2D sketch on the plane defined by the new coordinate system. Draw Curves 1. Draw line 1 from (0.0, 0.0) to (0.0462, 0.0). 2. Draw line 2 from (0.0462, 0.0) to (0.0462, 0.0052). 3. Draw arc 1 from (0.0462, 0.0052) to (0.0438, 0.0077). 4. Draw line 3 from (0.0438, 0.0077) to (0.0101, 0.0077). 5. Draw arc 2 from (0.0101, 0.0077) to (0.0077, 0.0101). 6. Draw line 4 from (0.0077, 0.0101) to (0.0077, 0.0438). 7. Draw arc 3 from (0.0077, 0.0438) to (0.0052, 0.0462). 8. Draw line 5 from (0.0052, 0.0462) to (0.0, 0.0462). 9. Draw line 6 from (0.0, 0.0462) to (0.0, 0.0). Create Faces Create faces from the closed loops in the sketch. Scale 2D Sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0462. Transform 2D Sketch to 3D Sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D Model Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal vector with a depth of 0.75 units. The boolean operation for this extrusion is to create a new solid body. Sketch and Extrusion Dimensions - The sketch has a length of 0.0462 units, a width of 0.75 units, and a height of 0.0462 units. - The extrusion has a depth of 0.75 units and a scaling factor of 0.0462. These dimensions are derived from the "CAD Assembly JSON". These instructions will help the junior CAD designer construct a model that matches the given specifications and final shape description. Note that these instructions are specific to the provided JSON data and other designs may require different or additional steps. Whether or not any assumptions were made during the development of these instructions is beyond the scope of this task.</description>
